key_points: Kathy Hochul becomes the first female governor of New York.
She was sworn in during a private ceremony overseen by Chief Judge Janet DiFiore.
Hochul takes over after Andrew Cuomo resigned amid sexual harassment allegations.
Cuomo defends his record in a farewell address, dismissing allegations as a "political firecracker".
A majority of New York's powerful state government positions are now held by women.
Hochul inherits challenges like COVID-19 resurgence, economic instability, and housing crisis.
She differs from Cuomo on COVID-19 measures, favoring mandatory masks for schoolchildren.
Hochul aims to change the governance culture from Cuomoâ€™s forceful approach.
Cuomo faces legal issues, including allegations of groping and misleading the public on nursing home deaths.
Hochul outlines a different governing style and plans to appoint new aides while reviewing current staff.
spokespersons: Andrew Cuomo (Former Governor of New York)
Melissa DeRosa (Top Aide to Former Governor Cuomo)
